tuv.seg: The Noble Great Vehicle Sūtra Siṃha’s Questions
Homage to all buddhas and bodhisattvas!
Thus did I hear at one time.
The Blessed One was dwelling in Rājagṛha on Vulture Peak, together with a great saṅgha of 1,250 monks and a great saṅgha of bodhisattvas.
The Victorious One is a peerless being.
Accompanied and attended By five hundred wealthy noblemen,
They went before the perfect Buddha.
Bowing their heads to the feet of the Buddha,
They offered the five hundred parasols. {3} Offering these to the Great Sage,
All of them set out for awakening.
By the power of the perfect Buddha,
Siṃha joined his palms in reverence
And asked the perfect Buddha, “Will the Guide please explain to me
How does one take miraculous birth?
How does one remember previous births?
Great Sage, please give your instruction
Knowing their pure intentions with his wisdom,
“I will give a teaching on what you have asked: The conduct of bodhisattvas.
One takes miraculous birth by pure conduct.
One recalls past lives by giving the Dharma.
Youth, know it to be thus!”
The thirty-two marks, the eighty excellent signs, And a body radiant like gold
Likewise, the excellent signs come to be through love.
The golden radiance of the victorious ones Manifests by having an attitude of equality toward all beings.”
Great Sage, please give your teaching!”
“Retention is attained through receptivity to the Dharma.
Absorption arises by training the mind. Statements become acceptable
O Sage, how does one become intelligent?
How does one come to act according to the Dharma?
O Holy Being, how does one become wise?”
“One comes to possess mindfulness by being undeceiving.
One becomes intelligent by contemplating meaning.
One comes to act according to the Dharma by having reverence.
One becomes wise by knowing the characteristics of phenomena.”
“By what action is a bodhisattva born
In the presence of the guardians of the world?
How do they come to ask questions
Directly before the guardians of the world?”
“The one who never obstructs The giving of Dharma
Come to meet the guardians of the world.”
“How does one relinquish rebirth in inopportune states?
How does one go forth to favorable states?
How does one become heedful Wherever one takes birth throughout all of one’s lives?”
One goes forth to favorable states through moral discipline.
One becomes always heedful By becoming familiar with emptiness.”
How do they dodge the snares of Māra?
How do they avoid becoming bereft of Dharma?” {19} “Karma is purified through firm resolution.
They avoid becoming bereft of the Dharma By acting according to their words.”
“How does one’s voice become like the pleasing song Of the kalaviṅka bird and like the voice of Brahmā?
O Sage, how does one please beings With their diverse inclinations?”
“The voice of Brahmā is obtained by speaking truthfully.
The voice becomes pleasing by abandoning harsh words.
One pleases beings By relinquishing senseless talk and slander.”
“How does one come to have a long life?
How does one come to have fewer illnesses?
Does a retinue come to be undivided?”
“One comes to have a long life by not killing.
One will have fewer illnesses by causing no harm.
A retinue comes to be undivided When one reconciles disputes.” {24} “How does one obtain wealth?
How do possessions cease to diminish?
Possessions increase by being without stinginess.
One will be distinguished wherever one is born
How does one obtain divine hearing? And how, O Guide, does one know
The dying, transmigration, and rebirth of beings?”
“Divine sight is obtained by giving lamps.
The ear is purified by giving music. The dying, transmigration, and rebirth of beings are known through wisdom.
“O Guide, how do the defilements of bodhisattvas
How do they recollect previous lives?
How do they obtain miraculous powers?”
“The miraculous powers are obtained by offering vehicles.
The recollections are gained by cultivating mindfulness. They reach the cessation of defilements
By fully abandoning the two extremes.”
How does its light shine perfectly
Such that the ten directions are illuminated?”
The saṅgha is perfected by magnetizing disciples.
The ten directions are illuminated brightly By offering jeweled canopies.” “By what quality does one attain
So that a bodhisattva will be dear to beings
Wherever they are born?” “By surrendering the mind to the purpose of awakening
In order to liberate all beings,
They attain the embodiment of all qualities
And will thus be held dear.”
“In what instruction should one train, And how should one cultivate the mind,
To become an omniscient teacher Like you, Great Sage?” “If one trains in being impartial
And if the mind is cultivated in that impartiality,
One will become an all-surpassing victorious one.” “Throughout all one’s lives,
How will the mind of awakening
Never be abandoned even in a dream,
Whether a village or a city,
By correctly guiding others toward awakening,
The mind of awakening is not abandoned.”
How can one acquire great strength
And always be elevated with power So that even ten million māras can do no harm?”
“In this life, if one offers the five essences
And gives courage to those who are afraid,
One will also have great strength,
Always be elevated with power, And be unharmed even by ten million māras.” Having heard this teaching
Directly from the Guardian of the World,
Spoke the following words: “We will train
Then the Buddha smiled, And the trichiliocosm quaked.
Ajita then asked the Buddha The following question:
The Buddha replied, “Ajita, please listen to the reason
That I smiled. “Previously, these boys assembled before
Eight hundred million buddhas and a quadrillion more.
They made offerings to those guides of humans. “Since the time of Dīpaṅkara—
The perfect buddha, supreme among people
I have been ripening These brahmin boys.
“They will become guides for the world
And their array will be Just like that of Amitābha.
They will always Meet with buddhas.
“Moreover, whoever hears but the name Under which they attain awakening Shall, without exception, become incomparable
And omniscient beings in the world.
Becomes inspired Will have merit unparalleled
“Consider someone who for six thousand eons
For the purpose of awakening. “The tally of that person’s merit Could never match or compare to
Hearing this Dharma presentation And setting out for the sake of awakening.”
When this Dharma had been expounded,
By the power of the Protector of the World,
The gods brought down a rain of flowers,
Having made offerings for one week,
Wishing to accomplish the welfare of beings,
They brought them to the Dharma of the buddhas.

When this Dharma presentation was taught, eight hundred million beings set out for supreme awakening. When the Blessed One had spoken, Siṃha, along with his companions and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas, rejoiced and praised the words of the Blessed One.
This concludes the thirty-seventh chapter, “ Siṃha’s Questions,” from the eleven hundred chapters of the Dharma presentation of The Noble Great Heap of Jewels
The Indian preceptors Dānaśīla and Munivarman and the chief editor-translator Bandé Yeshé Dé translated, edited, and finalized this according to the new lexical register.
